result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Marcus T Roberts Jr

records.addlTxt: Detainer LIFT filed with Milwaukee County Jail.

3:00  PM Defendant Marcus T Roberts Jr in court, in custody.  Attorney Jessica A Klein in court for Marcus T Roberts Jr.  Prosecuting attorney Melissa J. Zilavy in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Victim rights have been complied with by the Waukesha County District Attorneys Office. 
Court conducts a plea colloquy with defendant. 
State moves to dismiss and read into cases 21CF1184, 21CF1425 and 21CF1977. 
Defense does not object. 
Court dismisses and reads into cases 21CF1184, 21CF1425 and 21CF1977.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.
To Seal Victim/Witness Identification Key signed by Judge Bugenhagen Jr. on October 13, 2022

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing. Defendant to have no contact with victim A listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.

1:34 PM District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Julian Marrufo. Defendant Marcus T Roberts Jr in court, in custody.  Attorney Angela Wang in court for Marcus T Roberts Jr. 

Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint. 
Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties. 
Court advises of right to an attorney. Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  An attorney will be appointed. 
NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.
Hearing scheduled for November 1, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Victim/Witness Identification Key filed, under seal, by the District Attorney's office.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection and Notice of Intent to Use Defendant's Statement and DNA Evidence.
